item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Passing the vibe check
item.description: How to hang with Gen ZFrom transparency to safety, it’s clear that Gen Z’s priorities aren’t mysterious or superficial. From ethics to social issues, here are five areas that motivate Gen Z, plus a few Gen Z vocab words to add to your dictionary. This means high APRs and “buy now, pay later” offers are kinda sus4—and banks that don’t charge overdraft fees and do ditch their punitive debt cycles are likely to score the biggest W with Gen Z. )And for all our numbers people: 7 in 10 Gen Zers want safety and security in their lives. Brands have the reach, money, and scale to create change—change that Gen Z is adamant about seeing in the world. For retailers, this means Gen Zers want to walk into safe stores and use products made with safe materials. No. 5: Social issuesThe easiest way to earn Gen Z’s trust? Gen Z shoppers stan1 ethical brands—and they’ll go out of their way to shop at retailers that go the extra mile to treat their workforces with dignity. Gen Z is made up of many individuals and smaller demographic groups, and their collective ideals are built on style and substance. No. 1: EthicsGen Z supports brands that take care of their employees. But first: Why should Gen Z matter to me? Naturally, brands that use their influence to take a stance on important issues will be brands that Gen Z not only high-key5 loves but also trusts.
item.author: Morning Brew

item.title: The week ahead: May 9
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. While much of the pageantry will be the same as ever (a huge military parade through Moscow’s Red Square, for example), there’s also a great deal of apprehension this year over whether President Vladimir Putin will announce an escalation of what Russia has called a “special military operation” in Ukraine into a full-scale war. Everything else:The Senate will vote on legislation that would codify abortion rights into law on Wednesday. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeVictory Day in Russia: Today Russia will celebrate its most important holiday, Victory Day, which commemorates the Soviet Union’s defeat of Nazi Germany in 1945. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Wednesday is Eat What You Want Day (this has the raw cookie dough lobby written all over it). Inflation data: Wednesday’s Consumer Price Index report is expected to show a drop in inflation from last month’s blistering 8.5% pace, but not by much. css-1dlcpt7[data-focus]{z-index:1;border-color:var(--colors-primary);box-shadow:var(--chakra-shadows-none);}.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Tech startups feel the pinch from rising interest rates
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Tiger Global, the hedge fund with the most investments in private billion-dollar startups, is going through one of the worst stretches of any hedge fund in history, falling 44% so far this year and 15% in April alone.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: US solar industry in state of chaos during tariff probe
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It’s all because of one companyIn March, a small solar panel manufacturer in San Jose, Auxin Solar, asked the Commerce Dept. According to the Solar Energy Industries Association, 318 solar projects around the country, including one in Texas that would have powered more than 10,000 homes, have been canceled or delayed in recent weeks. to launch an investigation into whether Chinese solar products were being illegally funneled through other Asian countries on their way to the US. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe US solar industry is a hot mess right now. Big picture: The Biden administration is having a tough time squaring the industry-wide freeze with its goal of halving the cost of solar electricity by 2030. Solar advocates are livid with Auxin and the fedsRenewables leaders are flabbergasted that solar development has been put on ice at a time when the US needs to be ramping up clean-energy production to meet its climate targets. And receiving no imports from those countries is a big problem, because 82% of the most popular solar modules in the US come from there.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Museums reckon with their ‘finders keepers’ problem
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. But now, individual museums under the Smithsonian’s umbrella (including the National Portrait Gallery and the National Museum of American History) can individually decide to return artifacts, even when their hand isn’t forced by the law. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. And in the US, there have been ongoing efforts to return Native American artifacts: The Museum of Natural History has given back over 1,850 since 1998 to American Indigenous communities. Italy loaned back a fragment of the Parthenon Marbles (a goddess’s foot) this year. —JW
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: This recurring meeting needs to end
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. So while it’s usually best to be honest, it’s worth considering if you can get the outcome you desire without hurting any feelings. Share your workplace conundrum with Make It Work here. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}.

So you know a small music box with a barrel? item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Gucci to start accepting crypto in stores
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Gucci will start accepting $SHIB—as well as more than 10 other cryptocurrencies—at select stores later this month and nationwide this summer as part of the luxury sector’s wider push into crypto. But it’s playing catch-up to other luxury brands that have rushed to accept crypto for goods:Off-White announced in March that its flagship stores started taking crypto as payment. —JW css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Bottom line: A collab between luxury brands and crypto may be the best match since jazz and rain, because both rely on hype and clout. How it’ll work: In-store shoppers who want to reinvest their bitcoin into a crossbody will be emailed a QR code that allows them to complete the transaction using their crypto wallets. Philipp Plein is one-upping its peers by building a London store where customers can pay in crypto, browse an NFT gallery, and upgrade certain purchases with a corresponding NFT they can wear in the virtual world of Decentraland.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Starbucks wants its own meeting with the president after it met with union organizers
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. After Starbucks union organizers met with President Biden and other Washington A-listers on Thursday, the company sent an angry letter to the White House requesting its own meeting, saying, “We are deeply concerned that Workers United…was invited to the meeting while not inviting official Starbucks representatives.”
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Formula 1 heads to Miami
item.description: . Formula 1 is hosting the Miami Grand Prix tomorrow, marking the first time an F1 race will be held in the city. item.title: Gucci to start accepting crypto in stores
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Gucci will start accepting $SHIB—as well as more than 10 other cryptocurrencies—at select stores later this month and nationwide this summer as part of the luxury sector’s wider push into crypto. But it’s playing catch-up to other luxury brands that have rushed to accept crypto for goods:Off-White announced in March that its flagship stores started taking crypto as payment. —JW css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Bottom line: A collab between luxury brands and crypto may be the best match since jazz and rain, because both rely on hype and clout. How it’ll work: In-store shoppers who want to reinvest their bitcoin into a crossbody will be emailed a QR code that allows them to complete the transaction using their crypto wallets. Philipp Plein is one-upping its peers by building a London store where customers can pay in crypto, browse an NFT gallery, and upgrade certain purchases with a corresponding NFT they can wear in the virtual world of Decentraland.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Starbucks wants its own meeting with the president after it met with union organizers

item.title: Formula 1 heads to Miami
item.description: . Lewis Hamilton, the sport’s biggest star, said he may sit out the Grand Prix if the Federation Internationale d l’Automobile (FIA) enforces its ban on drivers wearing jewelry while in the car. Formula 1 is hosting the Miami Grand Prix tomorrow, marking the first time an F1 race will be held in the city. item.title: Museums reckon with their ‘finders keepers’ problem
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. But now, individual museums under the Smithsonian’s umbrella (including the National Portrait Gallery and the National Museum of American History) can individually decide to return artifacts, even when their hand isn’t forced by the law. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. And in the US, there have been ongoing efforts to return Native American artifacts: The Museum of Natural History has given back over 1,850 since 1998 to American Indigenous communities. Italy loaned back a fragment of the Parthenon Marbles (a goddess’s foot) this year. —JW

item.title: If Roe v. Wade is overturned, abortion pills could be the next target
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Abortion pills (aka medication abortions) already account for over half of all abortions in the US, according to the Guttmacher Institute. Texas passed a bill in December that would slap health care workers with jail time and a $10,000 fine if they prescribed abortion pills through telehealth services. —MM css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! How medication abortions work: Two drugs, when taken within the first 10 weeks of pregnancy, are 95% effective. Big picture: Most of the states waiting to pass restrictions on abortion have already attempted to make it harder to access abortion pills.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Elon lines up $7.1 billion in additional financing for his Twitter takeover
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The Saudi royal, who is one of Twitter’s largest backers already, said he’d roll over his current investment into the “new” Twitter. They include…Prince Alwaleed bin Talal: $1.9 billion. Seems like Elon will be pretty hands-on.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: E-commerce is flatlining in the first quarter
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Etsy and eBay shares both dropped by double digits yesterday after giving weak guidance for the current quarter. Amazon set the stage last week, reporting a 3% drop in online sales in the first three months of the year, and forecasting a meager 3% sales growth for the current quarter. Its shares plunged for their biggest one-day drop since 2006. Basically every major online retailer reporting earnings since then has shown signs of a clicking cooldown. —MK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! If it’s any comfort for online shopping companies, all stocks everywhere are getting clobbered, too.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: If Roe v. Wade is overturned, abortion pills could be the next target
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Abortion pills (aka medication abortions) already account for over half of all abortions in the US, according to the Guttmacher Institute. Big picture: Most of the states waiting to pass restrictions on abortion have already attempted to make it harder to access abortion pills. How medication abortions work: Two drugs, when taken within the first 10 weeks of pregnancy, are 95% effective. —MM css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Texas passed a bill in December that would slap health care workers with jail time and a $10,000 fine if they prescribed abortion pills through telehealth services. With federal protection out of the way, abortion pills would likely become the next target of conservative legislators and the anti-abortion movement. But there are other methods for abortions that are harder to restrict.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: E-commerce is flatlining in the first quarter
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Amazon set the stage last week, reporting a 3% drop in online sales in the first three months of the year, and forecasting a meager 3% sales growth for the current quarter. Etsy and eBay shares both dropped by double digits yesterday after giving weak guidance for the current quarter. —MK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! As shoppers abandon the tab for the fitting room, online retailers will have to pivot to stay competitive.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Ransomware attacks are part of the cost of doing business
item.description: . A 2022 report surveyed over 1,200 security leaders and found that 79% of those had been the target of a ransomware attack, and 35% admitted at least one of those attacks led to the loss of access to data and systems. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Coalition is one of the largest companies insuring against cyberattacks. In an exercise called a penetration test, or pentest for short, a company will attempt to hack its own infrastructure with a designated red team of hackers (i.e. bad guys) versus a defending blue team (the good guys). Though the FBI advises companies against paying ransom, many do because the alternative can mean a massive data leak, loss of profits, or worse. Ransomware as a Service offers technical support for hackers who require guidance on their ransomware attack, as well as services to transfer encrypted files once the ransom has been paid. Insurance companies are sometimes on the hook for ransomware payments. While many large organizations conduct threat assessments of their systems, the limitations of a test can prevent a realistic hack simulation. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. These macros allow a background program to run and execute code so that a hacker could pilfer data or upgrade their security privileges and wade further into the company. The hacker says they’ve already downloaded 250 gigabytes of user data and are threatening to release it if the company doesn’t comply within 24 hours. The JBS hack is exceptional, not simply because of its impact on America’s beef supply chain, but because it illustrates that hacks are now part of the cost of doing business. In one exercise, Rawlins’s team gained access to the message center of a stock exchange. The average company has more resources to protect against hackers than it did a decade ago, Sentonas said, but ransomware has become more frequent and far more sophisticated, including the rise of Ransomware as a Service. André Nogueira was woken up early one Sunday morning by a phone call telling him that his company, JBS Foods, the world’s largest meat supplier, had been hacked. Then he has to figure out if a ransom payment is legal or if it will violate any sanctions, which can be an issue with hackers outside the US. In some cases, Chainalysis can unmask the identity of a hacker involved with a ransomware attack, he said. Carter said he spends most of his time dealing with ransomware. He was given the distressing details: A group of hackers called REvil had gained access to the company’s critical infrastructure and was holding it hostage, demanding a ransom of $11 million in bitcoin. Realistic pentests and red-team exercises are important, Sentonas said, because “you play it like you practice.” Because getting hacked and paying a ransom is now a mundane business expense, a new industry has also popped up: cyber liability insurance. “The extortion piece is one part.
item.author: Ashwin Rodrigues

item.title: Guinness World Record set for longest career at one company
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The Brazilian recently set a Guinness World Record for spending his 84-year career at a single company. —JW All I care about is that tomorrow will be another day in which I will wake up, get up, exercise, and go to work; you need to get busy with the present, not the past or the future. Why? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Online mental health care startup Cerebral will stop new Adderall prescriptions
item.description: . Following a funding round led by SoftBank last December, Cerebral was valued at $4.8 billion. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Cerebral, the mental health telehealth startup, said yesterday it would pause Adderall and other ADHD medication prescriptions for new patients.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Fed enacts largest interest rate hike since 2000
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. But hiking interest rates is just one tool the Fed plans to use to bring inflation back down. “Inflation is much too high, and we understand the hardship it is causing,” Powell said at a press conference yesterday—the first one he’s held in-person since the pandemic began. Given that keeping prices stable is one of the Fed’s main responsibilities, critics say it’s been a total slacker over the past year and needs to get hiking to bring down inflation from its stratospheric heights. The Fed has heard that message. Fed Chair Jerome Powell jacked up interest rates by a half-percentage point yesterday. —NF Even Janet Yellen, the current Treasury Secretary and former Fed Chair, said Powell would need to be “skillful and lucky” to get this plane on the ground without hurting anyone.
item.author: Neal Freyman
